text: Hans Orlando Prade (23 July 1938 â€“ 3 April 2020) was a Surinamese diplomat. During his early political career, he worked with Ronald Venetiaan. Later Prade became a member of the Progressieve Nationale Partij. During the coup, Prade was a commentator on Suriname radio. Prade was the Surinamese ambassador to the Netherlands from 1981 to 1982. In 1991, he tried to run for President of Suriname, but lost the election to Ronald Venetiaan. Prade died on 3 April 2020 in Rotterdam of COVID-19, aged 81. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Ambassadors Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the Netherlands Category:Political commentators Category:Surinamese politicians
title: Hans Prade
